clinical_study.brief_title: Hemostatic Procedure After Biopsy of the Cervix
clinical_study.official_title: Is a Hemostatic Procedure Required After Biopsy of the Cervix Uteri in Women Undergoing Colposcopy for Cervical Dysplasia? A Multicenter Randomized Non-inferiority Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Zydolab - Institute of Cytology and Immune Cytochemistry

clinical_study.source: Zydolab - Institute of Cytology and Immune Cytochemistry

brief_summary.textblock: Cytological abnormalities of the Cervix uteri need to be clarified by colposcopy biopsy. To avoid bleeding after biopsy, monsel´s paste is a common used Agent. In a randomized clinical Trial the use of monsel´s paste after biopsy will be compared to no Intervention. The Primary outcome of the study is blood loss, secondary outcomes are pain, satisfaction of the patient and influence of Independent factors such as Age and Body mass index.

primary_outcome.measure: Blood loss after 15 minutes (5-step visual analogue scale)
primary_outcome.description: blood loss 15 minutes after biopsy will be measured judging the amount of blood on the sanitary napkin (5-step visual analogue scale)

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood loss after 3 hours (5-step visual analogue scale)
secondary_outcome.description: blood loss 3 hours after biopsy will be measured judging the amount of blood on the sanitary napkin (5-step visual analogue scale)

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood loss after 6 hours (5-step visual analogue scale)
secondary_outcome.description: blood loss 6 hours after biopsy will be measured judging the amount of blood on the sanitary napkin (5-step visual analogue scale)

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood loss after 24 hours (5-step visual analogue scale)
secondary_outcome.description: blood loss 24 hours after biopsy will be measured judging the amount of blood on the sanitary napkin (5-step visual analogue scale)

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensation of pain after 15 minutes (10-step visual analogue scale)
secondary_outcome.description: patients will score their pain Level using a 10-step visual analogue scale (VAS) 15 minutes after biopsy

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Sensation of pain after 24 hours (10-step visual analogue scale)
secondary_outcome.description: patients will score their pain Level using a 10-step visual analogue scale (VAS) 24 hours after biopsy

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Satisfaction of the Patient after 24 hours (10-step visual analogue scale)
secondary_outcome.description: patients will score their satisfaction Level using a 10-step visual analogue scale (VAS)

arm_group.description: cervical coagulation using a hemostatic agents, ie monsel´s paste

intervention.description: surgical method to stop bleeding by using the hemostatic Agent monsel´s paste until no more bleeding is visible
finishing examination without hemostatic intervention, awaiting spontaneous coagulation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- abnormal pap smear
- first colposcopy ever
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- bleeding disorder
- the use of blood thinner
- language barrier
- unwillingness to participate
